surnames_generator.factories package

Submodules

surnames_generator.factories.client module

class surnames_generator.factories.client.Client(init_params: Dict[str, Any], vectorizer: CharacterVectorizer)

Bases: object

Provide methods to select different models, optimizers, and loss functions.

Internally uses factories to manage the creation (initialization) of these components.

Parameters:

  • init_params (Dict[str, Any]) – A set of parameters for the initialization of the model, optimizer, and loss.

  • vectorizer (CharacterVectorizer) – The dataset’s vectorizer.

init_params

A set of parameters for the initialization of the model, optimizer, and loss.

Type:

Dict[str, Any]

vectorizer

The dataset’s vectorizer.

Type:

CharacterVectorizer

models_factory

Factory for creating models.

Type:

ModelsFactory

optimizers_factory

Factory for creating optimizers.

Type:

OptimizersFactory

loss_factory

Factory for creating loss functions.

Type:

LossFactory

loss_client(name: str) → Module

Selects and returns a loss instance based on the provided loss name.

The loss name is defined in the configuration file and the available losses are: 'cross_entropy' and 'nll'.

Note

If 'nll' is selected, nn.LogSoftmax() is applied to the prediction logits.

Parameters:

name (str) – The name of the loss class.

Returns:

An instance of the selected loss.

Return type:

torch.nn.Module

Raises:

ValueError – If the provided loss name doesn’t exist.

model_client(name: str) → Module

Selects and returns a model instance based on the provided model name.

The model name and the initialization parameters are defined in the configuration file. The available models are: 'simple_rnn_generator', 'gru_generator' and 'lstm_generator'.

Parameters:

name (str) – The name of the model.

Returns:

An instance of the selected model.

Return type:

torch.nn.Module

Raises:

ValueError – If the provided model name doesn’t exist.

optimizer_client(name: str, model_params: Iterator[Parameter]) → Optimizer

Selects and returns an optimizer instance based on the provided optimizer name.

The optimizer name and the initialization parameters are defined in the configuration file. The available optimizers are: 'sgd' and 'adam'.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – The name of the optimizer.

  • model_params (Iterator[torch.nn.parameter.Parameter]) – The model’s parameters.

Returns:

An instance of the selected

optimizer.

Return type:

torch.optim.Optimizer

Raises:

ValueError – If the provided optimizer name doesn’t exist.

surnames_generator.factories.factories module

class surnames_generator.factories.factories.LossFactory

Bases: object

A factory class for registering and instantiating loss classes.

_losses

A dictionary to store registered loss classes.

Type:

Dict[str, type[torch.nn.Module]]

get_loss(name: str, **kwargs) → Module

Returns an instance of the registered loss class based on the input name.

Parameters:

name (str) – The name of the loss class to instantiate.

Returns:

An instance of the specified loss class.

Return type:

torch.nn.Module

register_loss(name: str, loss: type[Module]) → None

Registers a loss class with the given name.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – The name of the loss class to register.

  • loss (type[torch.nn.Module]) – The loss class type.

register_model(name: str, model: type[Module]) → None

Registers a PyTorch model with the given name.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – The name of the model to register.

  • model (type[torch.nn.Module]) – The model’s class type.

Instantiates and returns a PyTorch optimizer by name.

  • model_params (Iterator[torch.nn.parameter.Parameter]) – Iterator of the model parameters.

Returns:

An instance of the specified

optimizer.

  • optimizer (type[torch.optim.Optimizer]) – The optimizer’s class type.
